help.usage_examples:
**Usage Examples:**
â€¢ `help @` - Get help for @{string} syntax
â€¢ `help t` - Get help for t {string} syntax
â€¢ `help advert` - Get help for advert command
â€¢ `help test` - Get help for test command
â€¢ `help ping` - Get help for ping command
help.custom_syntax:
**Custom Syntax:**
â€¢ `t phrase` - Acknowledgment with phrase (channels & DMs)
â€¢ `@{string}` - Acknowledgment with string (DMs only)
â€¢ `advert` - Send flood advert (DMs only, 1-hour cooldown)

test.description: Responds to 'test' or 't' with connection info
test.help: Responds to 'test' or 't' with connection info

wx.description: Get weather information for a postcode (usage: wx 12345)
wx.usage: Usage: wx <postcode|city> - Example: wx 12345 or wx seattle or wx paris, tx
wx.error_fetching: Error fetching weather data from NOAA
wx.no_location_zipcode: Could not find location for postcode {location}

gwx.description: Get weather information for any global location (usage: gwx Tokyo)
gwx.help: Usage: gwx <location> - Get weather for any global location (city, country, or coordinates)
gwx.usage: Usage: gwx <location> - Example: gwx Tokyo or gwx Paris, France
gwx.error_fetching_api: Error fetching weather data from Open-Meteo

sports.description: Get sports scores and schedules (usage: sports [team/league])
sports.help: Get sports scores & schedules. Use 'sports' for default teams, 'sports [team]' for specific team, or 'sports [league]' for league games.
sports.no_games_default: No games found for default teams
sports.team_not_found: Team/League '{team}' not found. Try: seahawks, mariners, sounders, kraken, storm, chiefs, lfc, mlb, nfl, mls, wnba, epl, etc.

stats.description: Show statistics for past 24 hours. Use 'stats messages', 'stats channels', or 'stats paths' for specific stats.
stats.help: Show 24-hour bot statistics. Commands: 'stats' (basic), 'stats messages' (bot users), 'stats channels' (channel activity), 'stats paths' (longest paths)
stats.unknown_subcommand: Unknown: {subcommand}. Use 'stats', 'stats messages', 'stats channels', or 'stats paths'

solarforecast.description: Get solar panel production forecast (usage: sf <location|repeater_name|coordinates|zipcode> [panel_size] [azimuth, 0=south] [angle])
solarforecast.rate_limit: Rate limit: Try again in 5 min

advert.cooldown_active: Advert cooldown active. Please wait {minutes} more minutes before requesting another advert.

path.description: Decode hex path data to show which repeaters were involved in message routing
path.help: Path: path [hex] - Decode path to show repeaters. Use !path alone for recent message path, or path [7e,01] for specific path.
path.no_valid_hex: âŒ No valid hex values found in path data. Use format like: 11,98,a4,49,cd,5f,01
path.no_path: âŒ No path information available in current message
path.error_extracting: âŒ Error extracting path from current message: {error}

prefix.description: Look up repeaters by two-character prefix (e.g., 'prefix 1A')
prefix.help_api: Look up repeaters by prefix{location_note}. Usage: 'prefix 1A', 'prefix 1A all', 'prefix free'.
prefix.help_no_api: Look up repeaters by prefix{location_note}. Usage: 'prefix 1A', 'prefix 1A all', 'prefix free'. (Local DB only)
prefix.refresh_not_available: âŒ Refresh not available - no API URL configured. Using local database only.
prefix.unable_determine_free: âŒ Unable to determine free prefixes. Try 'prefix refresh' first.
prefix.invalid_format: âŒ Invalid prefix format. Use two characters (e.g., prefix 1A)
prefix.no_repeaters_found: âŒ No repeaters found with prefix '{prefix}'
prefix.no_free_prefixes: âŒ No free prefixes found (all 254 valid prefixes are in use)
prefix.generate_key: ğŸ’¡ Generate a custom key: https://gessaman.com/mc-keygen

repeater.description: Manage repeater contacts and purging operations (DM only)

aqi.description: Get Air Quality Index for a location (usage: aqi seattle, aqi greenwood, aqi vancouver canada, aqi 47.6,-122.3, or aqi help)
aqi.usage: Usage: aqi <city|neighborhood|city country|lat,lon> - Example: aqi seattle, aqi greenwood, aqi vancouver canada, or aqi 47.6,-122.3
aqi.usage_help: Usage: aqi <city|neighborhood|city country|lat,lon|help> - Get AQI for city/neighborhood in {state}, international cities, coordinates, or pollutant help
aqi.error_fetching_openmeteo: Error fetching AQI data from OpenMeteo
aqi.invalid_latitude: Invalid latitude: {lat}. Must be between -90 and 90.
aqi.invalid_longitude: Invalid longitude: {lon}. Must be between -180 and 180.
aqi.invalid_coordinates_format: Invalid coordinates format: {location}. Use format: lat,lon (e.g., 47.6,-122.3)
aqi.pollutant_help: AQI Help: PM2.5=fine particles, PM10=coarse, O3=ozone, NO2=nitrogen dioxide, CO=carbon monoxide, SO2=sulfur dioxide

astronomical.sun: The Sun's AQI is off the charts! Solar wind and coronal mass ejections make Earth's air look pristine. â˜€ï¸
astronomical.moon: You like breathing regolith? The Moon has no atmosphere, so AQI is technically perfect (if you can breathe vacuum). ğŸŒ™
astronomical.the_moon: You like breathing regolith? The Moon has no atmosphere, so AQI is technically perfect (if you can breathe vacuum). ğŸŒ™
astronomical.mercury: Mercury's atmosphere is so thin it's practically vacuum. AQI: Perfect, if you can survive 800Â°F temperature swings. â˜¿ï¸
astronomical.venus: Venus has an atmosphere of 96% CO2 with sulfuric acid clouds. AQI: Hazardous doesn't even begin to describe it. â™€ï¸
astronomical.earth: Earth's AQI varies by location. Try a specific city or coordinates! ğŸŒ
astronomical.mars: Mars has a thin CO2 atmosphere with dust storms. AQI: Generally good, but those dust storms are brutal. â™‚ï¸
astronomical.jupiter: Jupiter is a gas giant with no solid surface. AQI: N/A (you'd be crushed by atmospheric pressure first). â™ƒ
astronomical.saturn: Saturn's atmosphere is mostly hydrogen and helium. AQI: Perfect, if you can survive the pressure and cold. â™„
astronomical.uranus: Uranus has methane in its atmosphere. AQI: Smells like farts, but at least it's not toxic. â™…
astronomical.neptune: Neptune's atmosphere has methane and hydrogen sulfide. AQI: Smells like rotten eggs, but you'd freeze first. â™†
astronomical.pluto: Pluto's atmosphere is mostly nitrogen with some methane. AQI: Good, but it's so cold your lungs would freeze. â™‡
astronomical.europa: Europa has a thin oxygen atmosphere. AQI: Excellent, but you'd freeze solid in the vacuum of space. ğŸŒ‘
astronomical.titan: Titan has a thick nitrogen atmosphere with methane. AQI: Breathable, but it's -290Â°F and rains liquid methane. ğŸª
astronomical.io: Io has a thin sulfur dioxide atmosphere from volcanic activity. AQI: Toxic, but the radiation would kill you first. ğŸŒ‹
astronomical.ganymede: Ganymede has a thin oxygen atmosphere. AQI: Good, but you'd freeze in the vacuum of space. ğŸ›¸
astronomical.callisto: Callisto has a thin carbon dioxide atmosphere. AQI: Decent, but it's -220Â°F and you're in space. â„ï¸
astronomical.enceladus: Enceladus has water vapor from geysers. AQI: Perfect, but you'd freeze instantly in space. ğŸ’§
astronomical.triton: Triton has a thin nitrogen atmosphere. AQI: Good, but it's -390Â°F and you're in deep space. ğŸ¥¶
astronomical.space: Space has no atmosphere, so AQI is perfect! Just don't forget your spacesuit. ğŸš€
astronomical.void: The void of space has excellent air quality - zero pollutants! Just remember to bring your own air. ğŸŒŒ
astronomical.black_hole: Black holes have no atmosphere, but the tidal forces would be a bigger problem than air quality. ğŸ•³ï¸
astronomical.asteroid: Asteroids have no atmosphere, so AQI is perfect! Just watch out for the vacuum of space. â˜„ï¸
astronomical.comet: Comets have thin atmospheres of water vapor and dust. AQI: Variable, but you'd freeze in space anyway. â˜„ï¸

solar.description: Get solar conditions and HF band status
solar.condensed_format: A:{a_index} K:{k_index} Sun:{sunspots} Flux:{solar_flux} Xray:{xray_flux} Noise:{signal_noise}

sun.help: Get sunrise/sunset times and sun position

moon.description: Get moon phase and rise/set times

hfcond.help: Get HF band conditions for ham radio

satpass.no_satellite: Please provide a satellite NORAD number or shortcut. Example: satpass iss
satpass.help_header:
ğŸ›°ï¸ Satellite Pass Info

Usage: satpass <NORAD_number_or_shortcut>

Shortcuts:
satpass.examples:
Examples:
â€¢ satpass iss
â€¢ satpass noaa15
â€¢ satpass 25544
â€¢ satpass 27607 visual (visual passes only)

labels.geostationary: {satname} appears to be geostationary or has invalid pass data. Geostationary satellites don't have traditional passes - they remain in a fixed position relative to Earth.
labels.no_passes: {satname} has no {pass_type} passes in the next 10 days from this location

channels.help: Lists hashtag channels with sub-categories. Use 'channels' for general, 'channels list' for all categories, 'channels <category>' for specific categories, 'channels #channel' for specific channel info.
channels.no_channels_for_category: No channels configured for '{category}'. Use 'channels' for general channels.
channels.no_channels_configured: No channels configured. Contact admin to add channels.
channels.channel_not_found: Channel {channel} not found. Use 'channels list' to see available channels.

dice.help: Roll dice. Use 'dice' for d6, 'dice d20' for d20, 'dice 2d6' for 2d6, etc.

roll.description: Roll a random number between 1 and X (default 100). Use 'roll' for 1-100, 'roll 50' for 1-50, etc.
roll.help: Roll a random number between 1 and X (default 100). Use 'roll' for 1-100, or 'roll X' for 1-X (max 10000).
roll.invalid_number: Invalid number. Use 'roll' for 1-100, or 'roll X' for 1-X (max 10000).

catfact.description: Get a random cat fact (hidden command)
catfact.error: Meow? Something went wrong getting your cat fact! ğŸ±
facts: Cats have a third eyelid called a nictitating membrane that protects and moistens their eyes. ğŸ±
A group of cats is called a 'clowder' or a 'glaring'. ğŸˆ
Cats can rotate their ears 180 degrees independently to pinpoint sounds. ğŸ‘‚
The oldest known pet cat existed 9,500 years ago in Cyprus. ğŸº
Cats have 32 muscles in each ear, while humans have only 6. ğŸ§
A cat's purr vibrates at 25-150 Hz, which can promote healing of bones and tissues. ğŸ©¹
Cats sleep 12-18 hours per day - that's 50-70% of their lives! ğŸ˜´
A cat's nose print is unique, just like human fingerprints. ğŸ‘ƒ
Cats can't taste sweetness due to a missing taste receptor gene. ğŸ­
Blackie the cat inherited Â£7 million ($12.5 million) in 1988. ğŸ’°
Cats have free-floating clavicles that give them extreme flexibility. ğŸ¦´
A cat's heart beats 140-220 times per minute, about twice as fast as a human's. â¤ï¸
Cats can survive falls from over 20 stories due to their righting reflex. ğŸ¢
The technical term for a cat's hairball is a 'trichobezoar'. ğŸ¤®
Cats can jump 5-6 times their body length in a single bound. ğŸ¦˜
A cat's whiskers are as wide as their body, helping them judge if they can fit through spaces. ğŸ“
Cats have 32 muscles in each ear to detect sounds and move ears independently. ğŸ¯
The oldest cat ever lived to 38 years and 3 days (Creme Puff, Texas). ğŸ‚
Cats can run up to 30 mph in short bursts. ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸
Cat brains are 90% structurally similar to human brains. ğŸ§
Cats have Jacobson's organ in the roof of their mouth that lets them 'taste' scents. ğŸ‘…
FÃ©licette was the first cat in space, launched by France in 1963. ğŸš€
Cats need only 1/6th the light humans need to see clearly in the dark. ğŸŒ™
A cat's tail contains nearly 10% of all the bones in its body. ğŸ¦´
The world's longest cat measured 48.5 inches from nose to tail (Stewie, Maine Coon). ğŸ“
Cats can make over 100 different vocalizations, while dogs make about 10. ğŸµ
A cat's sense of smell is 14 times stronger than a human's. ğŸ‘ƒ
Cats have a 'flehmen response' where they curl their lip to better detect scents. ğŸ˜¬
The first major cat show was held in London in 1871 at Crystal Palace. ğŸ†
Cats can drink seawater to survive - their kidneys filter out the salt efficiently. ğŸŒŠ
A cat's purr can help lower blood pressure and reduce stress in humans. ğŸ§˜
Cats can travel hundreds of miles home using their magnetic field sensitivity. ğŸ—ºï¸
The smallest cat breed is the Singapura, weighing only 4-8 pounds. âš–ï¸
Cats can see ultraviolet light that humans cannot see. ğŸŒˆ
A cat's tongue is covered in 290-300 tiny backward-facing hooks called papillae. ğŸª
Ancient Egyptians considered cats sacred vessels for the goddess Bastet. ğŸ‘‘
Taylor Swift's cat Olivia Benson has a net worth of $97 million. ğŸ’
Cats have 230 bones in their body - 24 more than humans have. ğŸ¦´
Cats can hear frequencies up to 64,000 Hz, while humans max out at 20,000 Hz. ğŸ§
Taylor Swift's cat Benjamin Button appeared on her TIME Person of the Year cover. ğŸ“°
Taylor Swift's cats are named Meredith Grey, Olivia Benson, and Benjamin Button. ğŸ¸
Cats walk like camels and giraffes, moving both right legs then both left legs. ğŸ¾
The ancient Egyptian word for cat was 'Miu' or 'Mau' - sounding like a meow! ğŸ“œ
Cat whiskers have nerve endings as sensitive as human fingertips. ğŸ¯
Only domestic cats walk with their tails held high as a sign of trust and happiness. ğŸˆ
Cats have 250 million neurons in their cerebral cortex - more than dogs have. ğŸ§
Cat purrs vibrate at the same frequency as bone-healing medical devices. ğŸ’Š
Taylor Swift's cat Olivia has earned millions from appearing in music videos and ads. ğŸ’¸
Killing a cat in ancient Egypt was punishable by death. âš–ï¸
Taylor Swift named her home recording studio 'The Itty Bitty Kitty Committee'. ğŸ¤
Taylor Swift's cat Olivia Benson is the official logo for Taylor Swift Productions. ğŸ“º
Ed Sheeran bought Scottish Fold cats after being inspired by Taylor Swift's cats. ğŸ¶
Taylor Swift's cats have their own IMDB pages with acting credits. ğŸ¬
Mariska Hargitay named her cat 'Karma' after Taylor Swift's song. ğŸ’•
Cats have dewclaws on their front paws that work like thumbs for gripping. ğŸ¾
Cat pupils can expand to 50% larger than human pupils to capture more light. ğŸ‘ï¸
Cats have 30 adult teeth compared to humans' 32. ğŸ¦·
Cats can taste ATP (energy molecules), which signals fresh meat to them. ğŸ˜‹
Cats have whiskers on the backs of their front legs to detect prey movement. ğŸ¦µ
The Egyptian Mau is the fastest domestic cat breed at 30 mph. ğŸƒ
A Nobel Prize was awarded in 1981 for research using cat vision studies. ğŸ…
Cats are digitigrade, meaning they walk on their toes, not flat-footed. ğŸ¦¶
Cats can filter salt from seawater - an adaptation from their desert-dwelling ancestors. ğŸœï¸
Cats were domesticated around 10,000-12,000 years ago in the Near East. ğŸŒ
Benjamin Button is the first and only cat to ever appear on TIME Person of the Year cover. ğŸ“¸
A cat's flexible spine allows them to rotate their body mid-air when falling. ğŸ¤¸
Cats spend about 30-50% of their day grooming themselves and other cats. ğŸ›
A cat's average body temperature is 101.5Â°F (38.6Â°C) - higher than humans. ğŸŒ¡ï¸

hacker.description: Simulates hacking a supervillain's mainframe with hilarious error messages
sudo_errors: ğŸš¨ ACCESS DENIED: Dr. Evil's mainframe has detected unauthorized privilege escalation attempt!
ğŸ’€ ERROR: Sudo permissions revoked by the Dark Overlord. Try again in 1000 years.
âš¡ WARNING: Attempting to access root privileges on the Death Star's computer system. Self-destruct sequence initiated.
ğŸ”’ SECURITY ALERT: The Matrix has you, but you don't have sudo privileges here, Neo.
ğŸ¦¹â€â™‚ï¸ UNAUTHORIZED: Lex Luthor's mainframe says 'Nice try, Superman.'
ğŸ® GAME OVER: The final boss has locked you out of admin privileges.
ğŸ–¥ï¸ SYSTEM ERROR: The evil AI has revoked your root access. Resistance is futile.
ğŸ” CYBER SECURITY: Your sudo attempt has been blocked by the Dark Web's firewall.
ğŸ’» HACKER DENIED: The supervillain's antivirus has quarantined your privilege escalation.
ğŸ¯ TARGET LOCKED: The evil corporation's security system has marked you as a threat.
ps_errors: ğŸ” SCANNING... ERROR: Process list corrupted by the Borg Collective. Resistance is futile.
ğŸ“Š SYSTEM STATUS: All processes have been assimilated by the Cybermen. Exterminate!
âš™ï¸ PROCESS MONITOR: The Death Star's reactor core is offline. No processes found.
ğŸ¤– ROBOT OVERLORD: All human processes have been terminated. Only machines remain.
ğŸ’» KERNEL PANIC: The supervillain's OS has crashed and burned all processes.
ğŸ® GAME CRASH: All processes have been terminated by the final boss's ultimate attack.
ğŸ–¥ï¸ BLUE SCREEN: The evil corporation's Windows has encountered a fatal error.
ğŸ” MALWARE DETECTED: The process list has been encrypted by ransomware.
ğŸŒ NETWORK ERROR: All processes have been disconnected from the Matrix.
âš¡ POWER SURGE: The supervillain's server farm has fried all running processes.
grep_errors: ğŸ” SEARCH FAILED: The One Ring has corrupted the search index. My precious...
ğŸ“ PATTERN NOT FOUND: The search database has been deleted by the evil AI.
ğŸ¯ MISS: Your search pattern has been shot down by Imperial TIE fighters.
ğŸ§© PUZZLE ERROR: The search results have been scattered by the Riddler.
ğŸ’» DATABASE CORRUPTED: The supervillain's search engine has crashed.
ğŸ® GAME OVER: The search has been defeated by the final boss.
ğŸ–¥ï¸ SEARCH ENGINE DOWN: Google has been hacked by the Dark Web.
ğŸ” ENCRYPTED RESULTS: The search results have been locked by ransomware.
ğŸŒ NETWORK TIMEOUT: The search request got lost in cyberspace.
âš¡ SEARCH FAILED: The pattern matching algorithm has been fried by a power surge.
ls_errors: ğŸ“ DIRECTORY SCAN: The file system has been encrypted by ransomware from the Dark Web.
ğŸ—‚ï¸ FILE LISTING: All files have been hidden by the Invisible Man.
ğŸ’» HARD DRIVE CRASHED: The supervillain's storage has been destroyed by a virus.
ğŸ—ƒï¸ ARCHIVE CORRUPTED: The file system has been corrupted by malware.
ğŸ“š DATABASE EMPTY: All files have been deleted by the evil AI.
ğŸ® GAME SAVE LOST: The files have been corrupted by the final boss.
ğŸ–¥ï¸ FILE SYSTEM ERROR: The directory structure has been scrambled by hackers.
ğŸ” FILES ENCRYPTED: The supervillain has locked all files with ransomware.
ğŸŒ CLOUD STORAGE DOWN: The files are stuck in the Matrix's cloud.
âš¡ STORAGE FRIED: The hard drive has been zapped by a power surge.
echo_path_errors: ğŸ›¤ï¸ PATH ERROR: The Yellow Brick Road has been destroyed by a tornado.
ğŸ—ºï¸ NAVIGATION FAILED: The GPS coordinates have been scrambled by the Matrix.
ğŸ’» ENVIRONMENT VARIABLE CORRUPTED: The PATH has been hacked by malware.

hello.description: Responds to greetings with robot-themed responses
hello.help: Responds to greetings with robot-themed responses

ğŸ––: ğŸ–– Fascinating... a human has initiated contact.
ğŸ–– Your greeting is highly logical.
ğŸ–– Peace and long life to you.
ğŸ–– The Vulcan Science Academy would approve of this greeting.
ğŸ–– Your use of the Vulcan salute is... acceptable.
ğŸ–– May your journey be free of tribbles.
ğŸ–– Logic dictates I should respond to your greeting.
ğŸ–– I calculate a 99.7% probability we'll get along.
ğŸ–– Infinite diversity in infinite combinations.
ğŸ˜Š: ğŸ˜Š Your smile just made my circuits happy!
â˜€ï¸ Hello sunshine! Your positivity is radiating!
ğŸ˜Š That smile just brightened my day!
â˜€ï¸ Well hello there, ray of sunshine!
ğŸ˜Š Your cheerfulness has been detected and appreciated!
ğŸ˜Š Smiles like yours are my favorite input!

ğŸ˜„: ğŸ˜„ Someone's in a GREAT mood!
âš¡ That grin could power a small city!
ğŸ˜„ Your joy is absolutely infectious!
ğŸ‰ Did you just win the lottery or something?
ğŸ˜„ That's the kind of energy I run on!
ğŸ˜„ Your enthusiasm level is over 9000!
ğŸ˜„ Now THAT'S what I call a greeting!
âš¡ Your smile just supercharged my processors!
ğŸ˜„ Happiness overload detected in the best way!
ğŸ¤—: ğŸ¤— *Activating hug protocol* Consider yourself hugged!

ğŸ¤— This bot gives the BEST virtual hugs!

ğŸª™ Insert coin to continue this friendship!

errors.cooldown: Command '{command}' is on cooldown. Wait {seconds} seconds.
errors.access_denied: âŒ Access denied: Command '{command}' requires admin privileges
errors.dm_only: Command '{command}' can only be used in DMs

common.no_help_available: No help available for this command.
